courses.description:
LITC-UE 1170 Writing for Children 
Teaching of writing for children as an art form to include analysis of outstanding examples of children's books, familiarity with the major divisions in which children's books are published; preparation and submission of manuscripts for children's book production.  Consultants with children's book editors, authors, and other representatives of book publication.

courses.course_name: Language and Literacy for Young Children
courses.description:
LITC-UE 1175 Language and Literacy for Young Children 
This course will consider the relationship between young children's language development and the acquisition of literacy. We will explore the nature of language, language development, language diversity, early reading and writing development, and the deep connection of language and literacy to all areas of learning.

courses.course_name: Lang & Read Instruction in Early Childhood
courses.description:
LITC-UE 1176 Lang & Read Instruction in Early Childhood 
Teaching the language related processes with special focus on development listening, speaking, reading and writing for native English language speakers and students who are English language learners. Varied approaches to teaching reading in early childhood programs are presented and tied to other curriculum areas. Students apply concepts by working with children to develop reading skills at developmentally appropriate levels.

courses.course_name: Lang & Read Instruction in Early Childhood II
courses.description:
LITC-UE 1177 Lang & Read Instruction in Early Childhood II 
Extends the language-related processes with special focus on developmental reading and writing. Varied approaches to teaching reading in elementary school programs are introduced. Students apply concepts by working with children in their field placement to develop reading skills at developmentally appropriate levels.

LITC-UE 1178 Lang & Read Instruction for Childhood 
Continuation of Language and Reading instruction for Childhood I.
